name: accomplishing
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
accomplish
C1 to finish something successfully or to achieve something: The students accomplished the task in less than ten minutes. She accomplished such a lot during her visit. I feel as if I've accomplished nothing since I left my job. Synonyms
achieve
attain formal
fulfil (MAKE HAPPEN) mainly UK
reach
realize (ACHIEVE)
Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples
to achieve somethingachieveAfter years of rejection, she finally achieved success on the big screen.fulfilI fulfilled my dreams of becoming a marine biologist.realizeUK There was nothing to prevent her from realising her ambitions.come trueI worked so hard to be a doctor, and now my dream has come true.accomplishThese goals will be extremely hard to accomplish.attainAfter years of struggle, the nation attained independence.
See more results »
More examplesFewer examplesYou can actually accomplish a lot more by gentle persuasion.If you are fit, the climb can be accomplished in less than three hours.He believes you can accomplish a lot in a relatively short space of time.New technology means that astronomers can accomplish in a single night what once took years.The new coach told the press that he believed his team could accomplish great things.
